channel.title: Hacking A client
channel.description: I have the client for this server, trying to connect to their IP with the ::item hack, but it won't connect :/ what do I do?

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I decompiled client.java, entered the ::item code, fixed one error, and now it cannot find all the sprites, is their anyway I can force it to make a .class file, so I can put it with the rest and run it?

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

you make the client send the uid to the server, theres a tutorial for it but alot of clients just have it disabled

and youre always gonna get errors when decompiling something, the only class youd need to decompile is client.java where you would put your item code, so just fix the errors in that class when you decompile it

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

^ The problem with that is, when I take the original client, decompile, edit it, and try to recompile again, I get a lot of errors, due to it not de-compiling properly, but also, I have the UID, what should I do with it?

And, I’m curious about hacking clients that’s why I wanna do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“eballer48, post:30, topic:417242”]back it up!? How the fuck did you back it up? Go to google search computer languages and post a few on here? Or do you just hang around the general disscusion fantasizing of perhaps actually knowing a language other english. Oh wait you already know one right? Cause colHOE means something in another language. Know what it means to me? Idgaf. Why? Because your just another dumbass winny little Bitch that runs his mouth over the internet and thinks he’s cool. So props man. Wanna see me back it up? K look at my dev thread, now the only skill i see of yours is talking shit, unless you’d like to link me to some work?

P.s. don’t even comment on my spelling there’s a thing called slang people tend to use on the internet, google that.[/quote]

youre the one running their mouth and trying to be cool, shut the fuck up, thanks.

OT: why would you want to cheat on an rsps anyway…?

The smarter solution would be to take the client that goes with whatever server you want to cheat on and inject whatever ::item code you have into that client

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:38, topic:417242”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=519174.msg3774504#msg3774504 date=1317981100]
Or they could be being smart and using RSA.
[/quote]
This is possible too…

But did you find anything have to do with the uid? :o[/quote]
Yes, isn’t their uid in the return statement? If so I do have it.[quote=“Coelho, post:35, topic:417242”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=519174.msg3774308#msg3774308 date=1317954594]

Thanks, but I think I might have gotten it. If not ill will try your decompiler.

EDIT: LOL thats the decompiler I have!

;D

But no, I get the same error, I replaced the whole signlink with the one with the newer client, didn’t work, but I have more idea’s on getting it to work
[/quote]
Decompile “client.java” in the victims client and look at the login packet. CTRL-F “Connecting to server”. Find where it gets the UID from and you are set.[/quote]
I will try this now.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Look in the client class for signlink.uid. Around that part the client may actually send other variables, usually it is your mac address or client version.

Or the packets could be scrambled.

Is there an easy way to directly manipulate variables from class files?

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:34, topic:417242”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=519174.msg3774306#msg3774306 date=1317954476]

Thanks, but I think I might have gotten it. If not ill will try your decompiler.

EDIT: LOL thats the decompiler I have!

;D
[/quote]
But no, I get the same error, I replaced the whole signlink with the one with the newer client, didn’t work, but I have more idea’s on getting it to work ;)[/quote]
Decompile “client.java” in the victims client and look at the login packet. CTRL-F “Connecting to server”. Find where it gets the UID from and you are set.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:29, topic:417242”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=519174.msg3774296#msg3774296 date=1317953955]

What return code (error) do you get when you try to log in?

No response from log-in server.

@ drubrkletern I will look their, but my error with trying to use their current client is, after de-compiling I get errors, so I’m using this method.
[/quote]
That is something wrong with your decompiler then try a different decompiler :o[/quote]
http://java.decompiler.free.fr/?q=jdgui
Beautiful decompiler. But also, any decompiler won’t deobfuscate it for you, so you can expect some of the code to be broken. You have to be willing to fix it

@eballer48 Now you are just flaming and being childish. You say I “run my mouth”, psh. If you can not help, please, stop being off topic or leave this thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A client
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:26, topic:417242”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=519174.msg3774286#msg3774286 date=1317953692]

This thread… its full of…
LULZ

OT
Maybe they have a certain UID? try getting it from their client if ur not using it…

I have their client off their site unpacked, but I am using their V1 client to try and connect, Where could I find this UID?

@Coelho: I’m not firing back at you for one reason, I want help, yet all you want to do is insult me, which is not help to me at all, just think before you speak.
[/quote]
I don’t want to give you false information, but in the means of quicker response, I’d have to guess uid.dat in the cache.[/quote]
I read a tutorial somewhere, and it used the signlink class, but idk, you can try that too.

Read full topic
